meanings.definition: The action of enclosing something in or as if in a capsule.
meanings.sent1: The encapsulation of the precious gem in a glass case protected it from harm.
meanings.sent2: The scientist explained the encapsulation of medicine in a pill for easy consumption.
meanings.sent3: The encapsulation of the cat in a bubble made for a funny sight at the pet show.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an encapsulation of joy that spread through the room.
meanings.sent5: The encapsulation of memories in a photo album made them last a lifetime.

meanings.definition: The process of enclosing one or more items within a container.
meanings.sent1: The encapsulation of the cookies in a jar kept them fresh for days.
meanings.sent2: The factory used encapsulation to package the candies in individual wrappers.
meanings.sent3: The encapsulation of the toys in a box turned into a game of hide-and-seek for the kids.
meanings.sent4: The encapsulation of thoughts in a diary was like locking secrets in a safe.
meanings.sent5: The encapsulation of music in a CD allowed people to enjoy their favorite songs anytime.
